intro: Helicia laiagamensis, commonly known as the Laiagamensis hellibaum, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its dense, glossy green foliage and distinctive yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest canopy. Its fruits are small, woody capsules that contain seeds dispersed by animals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
